summary: This document is a letter from Deutsche Bank Wealth Management confirming the decision to discontinue its relationships with Jeffrey Epstein and related entities. The letter outlines the request for the transfer of assets by February 28, 2019, while allowing limited access to accounts until that date.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the primary subject of the letter, which discusses the discontinuation of financial relationships with him.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Darren Indyke is mentioned as a client alongside Jeffrey Epstein in the correspondence regarding the financial relationship with Deutsche Bank.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.context: Richard Kahn is also mentioned as a client in the letter, indicating his association with Jeffrey Epstein in the financial dealings.

persons.name: Stewart Oldfield
persons.context: Stewart Oldfield is the Director at Deutsche Bank who authored the letter, confirming the bank's decision regarding Epstein.

persons.name: Armen Brash
persons.context: Armen Brash is another Director at Deutsche Bank mentioned in the letter, indicating involvement in the decision-making process.

connections.description: Both are clients of Deutsche Bank Wealth Management, mentioned together in the context of asset management.
Both are clients of Deutsche Bank Wealth Management, mentioned together in the context of asset management.

Stewart Oldfield, as a Director at Deutsche Bank, communicates with Epstein regarding the bank's decision to terminate their relationship.

events.title: Termination of Financial Relationship
events.description: Deutsche Bank Wealth Management informs Jeffrey Epstein and related parties of the decision to discontinue their financial relationships.

events.title: Deadline for Asset Transfer
events.description: The letter sets a deadline for Epstein and related parties to transfer their assets to another financial institution.

keyFacts: Deutsche Bank Wealth Management decided to discontinue its relationships with Jeffrey Epstein and related entities.
The letter requests the transfer of assets by February 28, 2019.
Jeffrey Epstein, Darren Indyke, and Richard Kahn are all mentioned as clients affected by this decision.
Stewart Oldfield and Armen Brash are identified as Directors at Deutsche Bank involved in the communication.
